founding_conditions.capital: Access to up to $15M via venture/angel capital if the opportunity is clean. $8-10M readily accessible; up to $15M for compelling physical/production plays. VC/angel appetite confirmed shifting toward hard-tech/robotics/physical-economy (a16z American Dynamism, BlackRock overweight industrials, JPM supercycle broadening, Goldman $500B+ AI capex).
founding_conditions.team: 2 founders -- ML/AI Masters (Georgia Tech) + operator (Argentina native, US resident)
founding_conditions.location: Davis CA -- 1hr from SF, direct access to UC Davis ag robotics ecosystem, Central Valley specialty crop growers, CA food production cluster
founding_conditions.markets: US + LATAM lowest friction, any geography viable on economics

history.reason: v2 reset -- balanced weights, no penalty premiums
First v2 cycle -- maintained balanced weights
Expanded scope cycle -- maintained balanced weights.
Deepening & correction cycle. Balanced weights maintained.

Quantitative deepening cycle. O*NET + BLS real data. Stress tests on top 3. Under-explored sectors assessed. Balanced weights maintained -- quantitative data now replaces qualitative estimates on automation exposure.

running_patterns.description: Multi-Sector Baumol Cure Convergence: Healthcare, legal, accounting, insurance all releasing stored above-CPI energy simultaneously
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: QUANTIFIED with O*NET + BLS data. Total automatable wage bill across 7 key occupations: $207B. Bookkeepers + Accountants alone = $139B. BLS wage growth continues above CPI in all Baumol sectors (professional services +4%/yr, healthcare +3.5%/yr vs CPI ~2.5%). The Baumol stored energy is STILL GROWING -- the cost advantage widens each year.

running_patterns.description: Demographic Gap + AI Readiness Convergence: Nursing, insurance, accounting, trades, AND manufacturing aging workforce meets AI capability maturation
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: BLS projections 2024-2034: Bookkeepers -5%, Claims Adjusters -5% = pre-cascade employment decline. CA AB 1175 signed Oct 2025 -- CPA licensing modernized effective Jan 2027, addressing pipeline crisis. 75% of CPAs nearing retirement confirmed.

running_patterns.description: Regulatory Fragmentation as Structural Moat: 47+ states + EU + NAIC + HIPAA + sector-specific creating compliance maze that rewards first navigators
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: NEW DIMENSION: Mental health AI regulation forming. Utah HB 452 (first state to regulate AI therapy chatbots, May 2025). Woebot's $123M failure confirms FDA pathway blocked. CPA licensing barrier lowering via AB 1175 but still meaningful moat. Regulatory fragmentation EXPANDING to new sectors.

running_patterns.description: PE Distress + AI Cost Collapse Double Disruption: Refinancing wall + AI margin compression creating asset acquisition window
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: Unchanged. Tariff uncertainty continues to suppress PE M&A activity, creating favorable environment for non-PE acquirers.

running_patterns.description: Jevons Expansion 3-5x in Professional Services: Unserved market consistently 3-5x current served market across accounting, legal, finance, education
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: QUANTIFIED: Bench Accounting collapse (Dec 2024, $113M raised, 35K customers) is a P4 Dead Business Revival signal. Market PROVEN at 35K customers. Failure was cost structure (AI+offshore human), not demand. 35K orphaned customers available. Combined with 23M unserved SMBs = Jevons expansion validated.

running_patterns.description: Robotics x AI Compound Production Cost Compression -- COGS reduction (not just SGA) in custom manufacturing, food, agriculture
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: COBOT ROI VALIDATED: 35% adoption surge in 2024, average ROI 12-18 months (best case 195 days). Cobots now 30% of new installations. Single cobot saves $65-85K/yr. O*NET confirms machinists 79% automation risk but manual dexterity resists = PARTIAL automation thesis confirmed. Stress test #2: operational complexity (not cobot ROI) is the real risk. 70% M&A synergy failure rate means execution capability is the differentiator.

running_patterns.description: Capital Allocation Rotation to Hard-Tech/Physical Economy -- VC/PE/asset managers shifting from pure-digital to physical production
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: Unchanged from cycle 3. BlackRock/JPM/Goldman consensus holds. No new counter-signals.

running_patterns.description: SBA 504 + Equipment Financing = Physical Production Capital Structure Advantage unavailable to digital businesses
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: Unchanged. SBA 504 fee waiver still active, expires Sept 30, 2026. TIME-SENSITIVE.

running_patterns.description: Christensen Three-Layer Competitive Framework -- tool layer crowding, service layer emerging, full-service layer empty across ALL professional services
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: CRITICAL UPDATE: Intuit replacing QBO Accountant with AI-native 'Intuit Accountant Suite' (Feb 2026). Accelerate plan $149/mo. This is Intuit moving from tool-layer to service-layer. The biggest platform incumbent is NOW at service layer. HOWEVER: Intuit serves accountants (B2B2C), not SMBs directly. Direct-to-SMB full-service remains the Christensen disruption play. Bench's collapse ($113M, 35K customers, Dec 2024) proves the market but also proves the difficulty. The three-layer framework holds but the service layer is getting more competitive.

running_patterns.description: Silver Tsunami Acquisition Window -- 2.34M boomer businesses, $10T transfer, 58% with no succession plan = 5-10 year acquisition window
Embedded AI Commoditizing Tool Layer -- Xero/Intuit, Westlaw/Lexis, EHR vendors adding AI natively, threatening standalone AI tool companies
running_patterns.cycle_4_update: UPGRADED to very_strong. Intuit's Accountant Suite replacement is the strongest evidence yet -- not just adding AI features but REPLACING the entire platform with an AI-native one. This is the pattern in action. Tool-layer AI startups in accounting face existential threat from Intuit.

running_patterns.description: Provider-Side Healthcare AI Arms Race -- WISeR/payer AI triggers counter-demand for provider-side AI to fight denials
NEW: Dead Business Revival at AI-Native Cost Structure -- Bench ($113M), Woebot ($123M) failures validate markets while revealing cost/regulatory failure modes that new entrants can solve
running_patterns.detail: TWO major P4 Dead Business Revival signals in cycle 4: (1) Bench Accounting (Dec 2024): $113M raised, 35K customers, collapsed because AI+offshore human model couldn't achieve profitability. Market proven. Failure mode = cost structure. AI-first model at $0.05/month inference solves this. (2) Woebot Health (Jul 2025): $123M raised, pioneering therapy chatbot, shut down because FDA pathway too costly/slow. Market proven (mental health crisis). Failure mode = regulatory. Sub-clinical and productivity tools avoid the regulatory barrier. Both failures are POSITIVE signals for correctly-structured new entrants.

running_patterns.description: NEW: Quantitative Baumol Cure Priority Matrix -- O*NET automation x BLS wages x employment = $207B automatable wage bill across 7 key occupations
running_patterns.detail: The Baumol Cure Priority Matrix cross-references O*NET automation risk, BLS wages, and employment to rank opportunities by total automatable wage bill. This replaces qualitative estimates with quantitative data. RANKING: 1. Accountants $75B, 2. Bookkeepers $64B, 3. Insurance Sales $22B, 4. Paralegals $20B, 5. Claims Adjusters $14B, 6. Medical Records $9B, 7. Tax Preparers $4B. TOTAL: $207B. The Baumol PREMIUM side: RNs $247B in human-premium wages, Lawyers $82B in judgment-premium wages. This data CONFIRMS the split: automate admin/clerical, enable/augment clinical/judgment.

tier_1.name: SMB Accounting/Finance (Full-Service Layer)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -2 (from 86). Intuit Accountant Suite moving to service layer. Bench collapse precedent. BUT: Bench's failure is P4 dead revival signal. Full-service direct-to-SMB remains empty. O*NET: bookkeepers 91% automation, $64B automatable wage bill.

tier_1.name: Healthcare Admin AI (Provider-Side)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. O*NET: Medical Records 97% automation (highest rate of any occupation). Provider-side thesis confirmed. No new competitive threats.

tier_1.name: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -1 (from 84). Stress test: cobot ROI CONFIRMED (8-14 months, 35% adoption surge). But operational complexity is the REAL risk (70% M&A failure rate). O*NET machinists: 79% automation risk but manual dexterity resists = partial automation validated.

tier_1.name: Specialty Food/Beverage Production
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score -1 (from 80). Stress test: margins viable for SPECIALTY (20-35%) but NOT commodity (5-10%). FDA PCHF compliance $22K yr1, $8K/yr ongoing. NEW risk: FSMA 204 food traceability + PFAS/microplastics concerns. Must target branded/specialty only.

tier_1.name: Insurance Claims AI (SMB/TPA)
tier_1.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. O*NET: Claims Adjusters 63% automation, Insurance Sales 80%. Combined $36B automatable wage base. No new data this cycle.

tier_2.name: Mental Health AI (Sub-Clinical/Productivity)
tier_2.cycle_4_change: NEW ENTRY. PROMOTED from Monitoring. Woebot $123M failure = P4 dead business revival. Massive Jevons (5-10x at $10-30/mo vs $150-300/session). FDA pathway blocked BUT sub-clinical + therapist tools viable. Utah regulatory moat forming. MindSync $720M shows market is real.

tier_2.name: AI-First Legal Services (SMB Corporate Niche)
tier_2.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. O*NET: Paralegals 90% automation ($20B automatable). Lawyers 23% (judgment resists). No new competitive data.

tier_2.name: AI Regulatory Compliance
tier_2.cycle_4_change: Score unchanged. Utah mental health AI regulation adds another compliance domain.

tier_3.name: Government/Municipal AI
tier_3.cycle_4_change: ASSESSED from Monitoring. Strong Baumol force but 12-24 month procurement cycles incompatible with startup runway. Established incumbents (Tyler Technologies $1.8B revenue, OpenGov acquired by Cox). NOT promoted.

monitoring.name: Perez Turning Point
monitoring.note: Goldman $527B capex deepens overhang. Build crash-resilient.

monitoring.name: Real Estate Transaction AI
monitoring.note: ASSESSED: EXTREMELY CROWDED. $10.5B funding, 7 unicorns. EliseAI $2.25B. NOT viable for new entry. Removed from under-explored.

Commoditizing (OpenAI, Hathr.ai) -- moat shifting to EHR integration
UPL enforcement tightening in several states
250+ bills + Utah mental health law. Deepening moat.
NEW: Intuit replacing QBO Accountant with AI-native platform. Moving from tool to service layer. Serves accountants, not SMBs directly.
NEW: $113M failure proves market but also proves difficulty. Creates moat for whoever solves the operational model. P4 dead revival.
UPGRADED: Intuit Accountant Suite is full platform replacement. Tool layer existential threat.
VALIDATED: Skills gap (not cost) is bottleneck. 70% M&A failure rate. Creates moat for capable operators.
$22K first year, $8K/yr ongoing. FSMA 204 traceability NEW in 2026. Strong moat.
NEW: Woebot $123M failure proves FDA pathway blocked for clinical AI therapy. Sub-clinical path viable.
NEW: HB 452 effective May 2025. First state to regulate. Others following. Creates compliance moat.
STRESSED in cycle 4. Operational capability IS the differentiator.
NEW: wheat, dairy, sugar volatile. Must target specialty/branded (pricing power) not commodity.
NEW: $10.5B funding, 7 unicorns. NOT viable for new entry.
NEW: 12-24 months. Incompatible with startup runway.

transmission_chains.note: Unchanged. Inference costs continue dropping. Cost advantage ratio widening as wages grow +4%/yr.
Intuit Accountant Suite = incumbent entering service layer. Bench collapse = dead revival signal. BLS: bookkeepers -5% employment outlook. Pre-cascade confirmed.
O*NET: Medical Records 97% automation. RNs 10% (Baumol Premium). BLS: Medical Records growing +8.7% despite 97% automation potential = Schumpeterian gap period.
Cobot adoption 35% surge. ROI 8-14 months validated. Constraint shifted from cost to skills. 30% of new installations are cobots.
Utah mental health AI law adds new dimension. Regulatory moat expanding to new sectors.
ADVANCED from N3-N4. Intuit Accountant Suite replacement is N4 (firm behavior). Platform vendors not just adding AI -- replacing platforms with AI-native ones.
NEW chain. Utah HB 452 = N2 (policy response). FDA pathway blocked = N3 (structure change -- clinical vs sub-clinical split). Woebot death = N4 (firm behavior). Chain moving fast.
NEW chain. Bench collapse (N4) creates orphaned customers and market validation (N5). AI economics at $0.05/month solve cost structure failure.

agent_a.cycle_4_note: QUANTITATIVE cycle. O*NET Polanyi classification + BLS wage/employment data provide the first fully quantified Baumol Cure Priority Matrix. Stress tests on top 3 with real competitive data. 3 under-explored sectors assessed with verdicts.

agent_b.cycle_4_note: Score adjustments: Accounting -2 (Intuit threat + Bench precedent), Manufacturing -1 (integration complexity), Food -1 (margin risk + FDA traceability). Mental Health AI promoted to Tier 2 (3 new models). Government/Municipal assessed for Tier 3 (1 model). Real Estate dismissed (too crowded).

key_unknowns_resolved.unknown: O*NET automation exposure for key occupations (quantitative)
key_unknowns_resolved.resolution: RESOLVED: Full Polanyi screen across 15 occupations. Bookkeepers 91%, Tax Preparers 99%, Accountants 67%, Medical Records 97%, Paralegals 90%, Claims Adjusters 63%, Insurance Sales 80%, Machinists 79%, RNs 10%, Lawyers 23%.

key_unknowns_resolved.unknown: BLS wages x automation exposure cross-reference
key_unknowns_resolved.resolution: RESOLVED: $207B total automatable wage bill across 7 key occupations. Bookkeepers + Accountants = $139B. Baumol Cure priority ranking established.
RESOLVED: Collapsed Dec 2024 ($113M raised, 35K customers). AI+offshore human model unprofitable. Market proven. Cost structure was the failure.
RESOLVED: Intuit Accountant Suite replacing QBO Accountant (Feb 2026). AI-native platform. Serves accountants, not SMBs directly. Accelerate plan $149/mo.
RESOLVED: 8-14 months average payback. 35% adoption surge 2024. Single cobot saves $65-85K/yr. Cobots 30% of new installations.

key_unknowns_resolved.unknown: FDA compliance cost for food production
key_unknowns_resolved.resolution: RESOLVED: PCHF $22K year 1, $8K/yr ongoing. Qualified facilities $300-2K/yr. FSMA 204 traceability NEW 2026.
RESOLVED: Woebot dead ($123M). MindSync $720M. Slingshot $93M. Talkiatry $130M. Utah regulating. FDA pathway blocked.
RESOLVED: EXTREMELY crowded. $10.5B funding 2025. 7 unicorns. EliseAI $2.25B. NOT viable for new entry.
RESOLVED: Strong Baumol force ($26B market) but procurement cycles 12-24mo, established incumbents (Tyler $1.8B), FedRAMP barrier. Tier 3 only.
RESOLVED: Signed Oct 2025. Effective Jan 2027. Lowers barrier (bachelor's + exam + 2yr experience). Transition through 2028.

next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Customer discovery interviews -- 5-10 conversations across top opportunities. NOTHING beats talking to customers. Target: (a) SMBs without CPAs, (b) retiring manufacturer owners in CA, (c) independent physician practices, (d) Bench Accounting orphaned customers.
PRIORITY 2: Narrow BizBuySell acquisition targets to 5-10 using specific criteria (owner retirement, $1-3M revenue, $300K+ EBITDA, CA location, existing customer contracts).
PRIORITY 3: SBA 504 CDC relationship -- contact Statewide CDC. Understand approval process for first-time manufacturing acquirer.
PRIORITY 4: Monitor Intuit Accountant Suite rollout closely. If Intuit announces direct-to-SMB full-service, accounting opportunity narrows further.
PRIORITY 5: Mental health AI deep-dive -- map state regulations following Utah, identify therapist productivity tool gap, assess sub-clinical wellness market size.
PRIORITY 6: Build prototype specification for #1 opportunity (whichever the operator chooses to pursue).
PRIORITY 7: Stress test #4-5 -- Healthcare Admin provider-side and Insurance Claims AI. These haven't been stress tested yet.
